column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
kathicm303, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from migraines for the past 44 years, nearly all of my life. Approx. 15 years ago, my PCP decided to concentrate on migraine relief. I tried many different things, but a combo of Paxil & Nortriptyline finally reduced my migraines from 2-3 PER WEEK down to 1-2 per month. Journalling my episodes provided essential tracking. During all of this, I was using Excedrin with marginal success, for my migraines. I then tried Imitrex with zero success. At some point, MaxAlt MLT-10 became available & my PCP handed me a bag full of samples to try. A few days later, right on schedule, I had my next migraine. I took 1 MaxAlt MLT & 30 mins. later it was gone. Not just gone, but as if it had never happened!! Over the past many years, I have continued using MaxAlt & it has never failed to vanquish even my most severe migraines! I'm sure many of you know what I'm talking about when I say I've awakened in the midst of a migraine so severe that I spent hours vomiting. Since MaxAlt dissolves on the tongue, vomiting does not reduce it's effectiveness much. I have had to take a second dose on a very few episodes, but it has always been effective within 30-60 mins. MaxAlt has literally saved my life by allowing me to work a steady FT position without constantly calling in sick due to my severe, crippling migraines.

column2: keri, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering from migraines for almost 1 year now.  I have been on a wide varitety of meds to include blood pressure meds and elavil, none of which helped.  My doctor keeps me stocked with samples of Maxalt MLT, most of the time I take two doses 1 hour apart at the first sign of my migraine and still have to resort to the narcartics or end up at the ER.  I am picking up Imitrex in the morning so we shall see how that works.  I don't recommend this med.

column2: mbrown, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

If I wait too long, it will take about two hours before I notice relief.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using this drug to treat my migraines for over a year. When I get an aura I take maxalt and 1000 mg of pain reliever, and then I go straight to bed if I am able to. I still get a lot of pain however, my migraines only last a couple of hours instead of a whole day or more. I do get some side effects such as, tightness in jaw, I'll get prickling sensations most often on my forehead (I'm not sure whether this is from the medicine or the aura), and when I wake up after my nap I am always extremely 'loopy,' and this can last throughout the following day as well.  However, I highly recommend maxalt since my migraines last only a few hours rather than the entire day, and I would much rather deal with the few side effects than the unbearable pain of a migraine. (I have had 6 migraines in the past 4 weeks, 4 of them in the past 2 weeks)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column9: My migranes have been high in frequency lately.  I woke up out of a dead sleep with a full blown aura.  I couldn't find my Imitrex so I was forced to use Maxalt MLT from my daughters stash. I will spend the day in the ER if I don't get meds, my blood pressure drops, and I am in severe pain (I would rather be in labor with no pain reliever!)Maxalt so far, which is twice, has COMPLETLY taken the migrane away, it's so awesome! column2: shitch,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have found that in most of my migraine attacks Maxalt-MLT has work wonderful for me. It is the most easiest and convenient medication I have taken for my migraine. It has been a life safer for me when the attacks have come on at work and there is no need for water to ingest the tablet; just let it dissolve on your tongue and let it do its job! JUST WONDERFUL

column2: cathy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Have migrain headaches and fibromyalgia.  Have taken for years.  Relief fast

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Have taken for several years. Leaves a lingering unpleasant taste.  Now stops the headache after one dose about 75% of the time. Initially it stopped the headache 95% of the time with a single dose.

column2: schaalamn@snet.net, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Works great 95% of the time with just one dose. This is the most success I have had with all the many drugs I have tried. No side effects at all. I wish it had not taken so many years to find it!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it made me extremely nauseous for hours and my migraine never went away.  I took the medicine again, following what my neurologist had told me, and still no luck.
